properties.COMMENTS1: Extensive alluvial workings surround the mine. Woodall (1990) estimates total reserves and indicated resources of this mine at 750 000t, grading 4.0g/t Au and containing 3 000kg of Au.
Identified resources contain less than 1% MgO and 5% of silica and alumina. Quality of limestone matches standards for cement production.
No traces of past exploration were noted in this place during the field visit. Location amended to middle of company drilling grid 27/11/03 JD.

properties.COMMENTS2: tersections from 2011 diamond drilling include 3.4m @9.7 g/t Au from 24.6m (SHDD004), 4.7m @5.7g/t Au from 28.6m (SHDD005), 20.0m @1.6g/t Au from 100m (SHDD007) (Thor Mining ASX Ancmt 20/12/2011). Recent diamond drilling returned as SHDD008A 11.0m @ 5.1

properties.COMMENTS1: Most of the old workings were destroyed by more recent exploration.

properties.COMMENTS1: The orebody occupied the hinge area of a east-west trending anticline. Juno also produced 2,752 kg of silver. A further 400t of ore yeilding 60.6kg Au, 1.6t Bi and 9.6t Cu was reported from the mill clean up in 1980 (Adams 1986). Diamond hole EJD004 assa
properties.COMMENTS2: yed with 13m @ 42 g/t Au from 160m Incl 5m @ 102 g/t from 164m (ASX Announcement 16/11/2009).

Source: Intierra website 2012. Production figure is for all the Bootu Creek Operations.

properties.COMMENTS2: Mistry. Inferred resource applies to a part of the field (Mount Carrington's prospect).
properties.PRODCOMMEN: AngloGold Australia Ltd mined oxide ore between July and Novemeber 2000. Ore was trucked to and processed at the Union Reef mine.

properties.COMMENTS1: Interbedded grewacke and siltstone with bedding parallel quartz microdiorite. Anticline. Stock of microgranite sub-parallel to the bedding nearby. Quartz-hematite vein 1.5 km ESE of the main grid carries very high gold values. Entire mineralisation confi
properties.COMMENTS2: ned to quartz veining. Best results from Shallow RC drilling at Old Pirate include  OPRC0023 returned with 52m @ 3.93 g/t Au from 4m, OPRC0035 returned with 50m @ 2.6 g/t Au from 6m, OPRC0018 returned with 55m @ 1.38 g/t Au from surface and OPRC0054 retu

properties.COMMENTS1: The area containing the diamondiferous pipes is known as Merlin. There are 13 known pipes in this general area. Kimberlite pipe intruding Bukalara Sandstone.
properties.PRODCOMMEN: Production for Merlin Kimberlite field (to Dec 2002) is 2.2Mt for 406,000 cts.

properties.COMMENTS1: Best intersection was from the drillhole RB08-17 44m @7.1 % Cu including 22m@ 13.22% Cu (ASX Announcement 12/06/08)

properties.COMMENTS1: Original resource estimate was 64,300t grading 62.5% Fe and 0.074% P (Barrell, 1968). The southern portion (Helene 2B) of this deposit was mined. The northern portion (Helene 2A) consists of a 42m lens that may contain 30,300t of ore grading 62.3% Fe (Ba
properties.COMMENTS2: rrell, 1968).

properties.COMMENTS1: Up to 10 ore lenses are identified within 4 main lode systems within a series of tight syncline structures. The deposit was extensively drilled (106 percussion and 5 diamond holes) by New Consolidated Gold Fields.

Original ore resource was 62 100t grading 65% Fe and 0.074% P (Barrell, 1968). In March 1974, it was stated that 43 000t had been mined and a further 66 000t of ore was remaining. While a letter from N. Barrell (Dec, 1968) states that 173,000t  had been
properties.COMMENTS2: mined and 333,00t of ore remained. Production figure is a visual estimate.

properties.COMMENTS1: Original (Jan. 1968) resource estimate was 1.07Mt grading 63.1% Fe (Chart 2, in Barrell, 1968). It is stated that the deposit was mined out by Sept. 1973 (McKenna's Table in Barrell, 1968). However the size of the open cut is quite small relative to the
properties.COMMENTS2: size of the estimated orebody. 330,000t @ 58% Fe was estimated in Feb 71. The length and width of the iron ore lens has been taken from a mine plan.
properties.PRODCOMMEN: Production figure is a visual estimate.

properties.COMMENTS1: Original resource (Jan. 1968) was 6.14Mt grading 63.4% Fe (Chart 2 in Barrell, 1968). The ironstone orebody occupied a north plunging syncline-anticline structure and outcroped as three (Helene 6, 7 and 8) lenses. It is not known if the orebody was mined
properties.COMMENTS2: out, because in May, 1974 Crohn (in Barrell, 1968) states that about 945,600t grading 65.4% Fe and 0.051% P remained at the RL500' level.

properties.PRODCOMMEN: 13Mt of oxide ore was processed by heap leaching, and 5Mt of primary zone ore was processed through the treatment plant. Source: General Gold Resources N.L. Prospectus (March, 1999).

properties.COMMENTS1: The Bigryli deposit consists of 15 separate anomalies over a 14km strike length. The deposit has 2770t contained U (non-JORC; Jindalee ASX Release 21Apr05). The dimensions given are of combined Anomaly 15 and Anomaly 15 Ex. Other results: 1.9M @ 1.31%U3O
properties.COMMENTS2: 8 from 30.6m (BPH-238) in Anomaly 2; 3.8m @ 1.49% U3O8 from 24.7m in BPH-225(Anomaly4) 3.3m @ 1.28% U3O8 from 60m (BPH-166; Anomaly8). Mineralisation open down-plunge from Anomaly 15. High vanadium.

properties.COMMENTS1: The area containing the diamondiferous pipes is known as Merlin. There are 13 known pipes in this general area. Kimberlite pipe intruding Bukalara Sandstone.
properties.PRODCOMMEN: Source: (ASX Sep quarter Rep, 30th Sep 2006)

properties.COMMENTS1: The deposit occupies surface area of approximately 60 square kilometres. The location given is the centre of this area.  The standard profile from the top consists of soil layer (av. 0.7m), loose pisolitic bauxite layer, cemented pisolitic bauxite, tubul
properties.COMMENTS2: ar bauxite, nodular bauxite, nodular ironstone, mottled clay zone, saprolite zone, clayey shale base. Average thickness of bauxite bed is 3.5m (Somm, 1975).
properties.PRODCOMMEN: 125 MT of bauxite, 60% Al2O3.Production from 1997 to 2010 is from Intierra website, grade is not reported.

properties.LOCDESC: This is the location of the drill hole LB094 MK.

properties.COMMENTS1: The deposit trend approximately east-west, and contains two ironstone lenses. The east lens was 240m long and up to 18m wide. The west lens is folded into a synform and is 240m long and up to 30m wide. Ore resource  estimate (Sept. 1973) was 87,511t grad
properties.COMMENTS2: ing 63.3% Fe and 0.06% P (Barrell, 1968). Original estimate for Jasmine (West, Center & East) was 800,000t to 30m depth (Dickinson, 1962). Then revised to 426,000t grading 60.0% Fe (Chart 2 in Barrell, 1968).

properties.COMMENTS1: Scheelite, Molybdenite, chalcopyrite and pyrite mineralisation occurs both as disseminated and massive in magnetite skarn that forms a raft or roof pendant in granite. Best drilling intersections include 16.4m @ 0.84% WO3 & 0.56% MoS2 from 43.6m (MHDD074
properties.PRODCOMMEN: 70t WO3.

properties.COMMENTS1: The Green Parrot Mine became operational in 1981 but closed down within 12 months due to low metal prices. Recent drilling highlights from the Jervois Project include 60m @ 1.73% Cu, 3.81% Pb, 1.15% Zn, 113.3g/t Ag, 0.21g/t Au from 7.1 m (Hole JMET11), 1
properties.COMMENTS2: 6.3m @ 1.87% Cu, 55.3g/t Ag and 0.59g/t Au from 15.2 m (Hole JMET3) and 10.3m @ 2.1% Cu and 13.3g/t Ag from 17.4 m (Hole JMET4) (Kentor Gold ASX Ancmt 8/06/2012).
properties.PRODCOMMEN: Ore treated was 14,500t. 12,00t of ore was stockpiled and about 20,000t of low grade ore also stockpiled (Reg of Aust Mining 1987).

properties.COMMENTS1: 10-20m of transported cover overlying this region. Australian Mining Monthly, November 1994 reports best results from drilling over this  prospect as 12 m of 2.5 g/t Au in quartz veinlets in metasediments.

The deposit comprises seven, stacked stratiform orebodies, each separated by dolomitic siltstones and sedimentary breccias. Mining selectively extracts the higher grade (17.4%Zn, 6.6%Pb, 70g/t Ag) No2 orebody and a blend of No3 and No4 orebodies which li
properties.COMMENTS2: e between 140 and 400m below the  surface. The average thickness of the No2 orebody is 3.3m, but reaches up to 8m along the eastern edge of the deposits. Exploration by the BMR; BMR Rec. 1962/137, 1964/159, 1965/173, 1967/79.
properties.PRODCOMMEN: Source: Contained metal is actual metal recovered. Only about 80% Zn and 50% Pb metal is recovered from the Pb-Zn-Ag ore (MinMet production data to Dec 2010).

properties.COMMENTS1: Overall thickness of ironstone unit is about 4m. The soft oolitic to pisolitic ironstone ore forms the upper 2.5m of the section. Surface samples of the oolitic ore assayed 54.8% Fe (R016) and 54.3% Fe (R015). DDH W21 intersected 4.1m grading 36.9% Fe &
properties.COMMENTS2: 19.2% SiO2 from 39.6m (Bennett & Heaton, 1958).

properties.COMMENTS1: Not inspected. The pisolitic-oolitic ironstone bed is up to 4.8m thick and is unconformably overlain by Cretaceous claystone (Cochrane, 1955). A nearby drill hole (DDH X31) intersected 2.2m grading 42.9% Fe & 8.7% SiO2 from 39.6m (Bennett & Heaton, 1958)

Ore resource estimated by Canavan (1965). The main massive oolitic ironstone bed is 2.5-4.5m thick. Surface assays of this material ranges from 43-63% Fe (average ~52% Fe). DDH W26 intersected 4.5m grading 42.9% Fe & 12.5% SiO2 from 18.7m (Bennett & Heat
properties.COMMENTS2: on, 1958). Oolites consist of ochreous hematite with a fine quartz grain commonly forming the nucleus. Best results from recent drilling include 3m @ 53.6% Fe from 8m (RCW154), 3m @ 52.8% Fe from 7m (RCW159), 3m @ 53% Fe from 25m (RCW163), 4m @ 54% Fe fr
properties.COMMENTS3: om surface (RCW174), 3m @ 53.6% Fe from 1m (RCW169), 3m @ 51.3% Fe from 9m (RCW192), 4m @ 51.5% Fe from 1m (RCW243), 4m @ 51.8% Fe from 5m (RCW244) and 4m @ 55.4% Fe from 11m (RCW244) (ASX Ancmt 14/09/2010).

properties.COMMENTS1: Overall thickness of ironstone unit is about 4m. The soft oolitic to pisolitic ironstone ore forms the upper 2.5m of the section. A surface bulk sample (BS5) of the oolitic ore assayed 47.7% Fe, 23.9% SiO2 & 0.044% P (Baker & Edwards, 1956). DDH U18 inte
properties.COMMENTS2: rsected 3.9m grading 45.6% Fe & 14.0% SiO2 from 55.5m (Bennett & Heaton, 1958).

properties.COMMENTS1: Overall thickness of ironstone unit is about 3.5m. The soft oolitic to pisolitic ironstone ore forms the upper 2m of the section. Surface samples of the oolitic ore assayed 48.4% Fe (R014-upper part) and 40.0% Fe (R013-lower sandy part). DDH T19 intersec
properties.COMMENTS2: ted 3.35m grading 41.3% Fe & 15.5% SiO2 from 39.6m (Bennett & Heaton, 1958).

properties.COMMENTS1: Past production and ore reserve figures are for all the Mn deposits on Groote Eylandt, north of Emerald River. The Mn ore bed overlies Proterozic quartz sandstone (Dalumbu Sandstone) in the northern part of D quarry. Ore bed averages about 3m in thicknes
properties.COMMENTS2: s and dips to the southwest with increasing overburden. Other ore minerals include: Nustite, Hollandite, Vernadite, Birnessite and Chalcophanite (Ostwald 1988).
properties.PRODCOMMEN: Production data from 1997 is confidential.

properties.COMMENTS1: Includes quarries E, A, B and G. Past production and ore reserve figures are for the all Mn deposits on Groote Eylandt, north of Emerald River. Inverse grading and trough cross-bedding in pisolitic Mn ore is seen at G quarry. Average thickness of the ore

properties.COMMENTS1: Age of mineralisation given after Black and Gulson (1978). Williams (1967) reported also several phosphate prospects (Enterprise 1-5) from this area. Best zircon comes from this locality. Production commenced in 1995. The EIS prepared by the Clutha Miner
properties.COMMENTS2: als.
properties.PRODCOMMEN: Source: Imerys Vermiculite ASX Announcement 1/07/ 2000 and Dept of Resources production data from titles division.

properties.COMMENTS1: The gold-bearing vein extends down dip for at least 1500m, where it flatten to sub-horizontal. The vein pinches and swells between 0.5 and 4m in the mine area, but averages between 1 and 2m (Sirrocco Resources, 1998). Gold is present as particles of elec
properties.COMMENTS2: trum within coarse grained arsenopyrite that forms a). veins replacing carbonaceous laminae and earlier formed pyrite and b). in fractures within the quartz lode (Sheppard et al., 1990).
properties.PRODCOMMEN: Source:  ASX Report 31/03/2007.

properties.COMMENTS1: Peko mine also produced 41, 317 kg of silver (at 14g/t Ag). The Peko orebody contained four mineralogical zones: (1) Upper oxidised zone- secondary gold; (2) Lower oxidised zone- cuprite and native copper, some gold; (3) Supergene zone- chalcocite, chalc
properties.COMMENTS2: anthite, malachite, patchy high grade Au; (4) Primary zone- chalcopyrite, pyrite, pyrrohotite, Bi-, Pb, and Zn-sulphides in quartz magnetite (Pontifex 1964). Other minerals present include: bornite, cobaltite, wittchenite, molybdenite, wolframite, tetrah
properties.PRODCOMMEN: Source: NTGS Rep. 11 (Ahmad et al, 1999)

properties.COMMENTS1: Subsurface deposit which consists of two major and several smaller oblate lenses of ironstone. The No1 orebody is well zoned, displaying a lateral and vertical mineral zonation from gold ore pods in the footweall, into bismuth-rich then copper-rich zones
properties.COMMENTS2: (Wedekind & Love 1990). The deposit appears to be bounded by the Footwall Fault and hangingwall quartz porphyry intrusion. The tailings are under feasibility study.
properties.PRODCOMMEN: 1994-97 retreatment  of mine tailings. Production in 1999 from a small open pit (Pers Comm. Dave Richards 2000).

properties.COMMENTS4: .04 % Fe from 70m & 4 m @ 55.2 % Fe from 82m, RBRC610 2m @ 57.1 % Fe from 43m,RBRC608 5m @ 55.3 % Fe from 28m (ASX Ancmt 13/09/2010). The Roper Bar deposits have low level of impurities i.e. phosphorous etc (Western Des ASX Ancmt 21/12/2010).

properties.COMMENTS1: Combined resource for Bellbird, Bellbird North, Reward and Green Parrot is 13.5 Mt @ 1.3% Cu and 25.8 g/t  Ag (Kentor Gold Ltd ASX An 7/11/12). Resource is JORC compliant. Mrshall-Reward and Bellbird deposit Gold resource  is 12.7 Mt @ 0.17 g/t Au.

The resource extends along a large open folded mesa over 8kms in length and 2 to 3kms in width, coincident in area with historic BHP Deposits A, B and C, the Sherwin Creek resource is contained within two separate zones (Middle and Lower) that are shallo
properties.COMMENTS2: w, continuous and open down dip (Sherwin Iron ASX Anmt 10/11/2011).
